title: Sainsbury's shoppers' fury over £50 Dyson deal after many 'queue from 4am'
text:

Sainsbury's shoppers have been left livid after heading into stores in search of the retailer's £50 Dyson vacuums sale - only to be turned away by staff.

Seven Dyson and GTech devices were rumoured to be knocked down today in what's been one of the biggest markdowns of the vacuum cleaners to date.

It included the Dyson V6 Trigger (usually £149.99), which has since been slashed to £50 and several other pricey vacuums.

And as a result, shoppers have been scouting stores since the early hours in hope of finding one before they sell out completely.

One worker at a Sainsbury's store in Birmingham said staff have been inundated with calls from customers since Tuesday evening.

However, there was no sign of the Dyson gadgets on the shelves on Wednesday morning.

The employee told the Birmingham Live: "The phone calls have been going on since last night, I worked the night shift and the queues were building outside from 4am."

Now customers say they've been left disappointed by the promotion which appears to be somewhat of a postcode lottery.

So much so that the supermarket chain has now apologised for the "miscommunication", which has left it inundated with requests online.

The same Birmingham manager has now claimed no city stores are selling Dyson vacuum cleaners for £50 - and blamed a leaked "internal message" for 100 people queueing up outside the store.

Have you been left disappointed by the offer - or managed to find the deal in your local store? Get in touch: webnews@mirror.co.uk.

Taking to Twitter, social media users slammed the retailer, with many sharing their stories of disappointment.

"Selected stores? Just been to Sainsbury’s Calcot, Reading and they said they haven’t got any Dyson vacuums," a disgruntled customer said.

"Missed boxing training this morning to get to Sainsbury’s for 8am to get the Dyson that was reported to be £50. Of course they didn't have any in. I don’t no whether I am more disappointed about not getting the hoover or the fact I was excited about getting a hoover," another wrote.

Several others also claimed they were told it's a "hoax" and a "scam" by Sainsbury's workers after heading into stores to enquire about the offer.

The good news is that Sainsbury's has confirmed the deal is legitimate online - however, it has warned that the offer is not nationwide.

"I can confirm that this is a legitimate offer to clear some remaining stock," the supermarket wrote on Twitter after being inundated with requests from shoppers desperate to find out what branches and regions are participating in the sale.

But all is not lost as those who have got lucky are absolutely thrilled.

One happy customer tweeted: "Woo Hoo! Just got home from @sainsburys Wolverhampton and already using my Dyson V6 Animal that I paid only £50!!!!

"They are like £199 in Currys! Loving it.. Thanks Sainsbury’s.... that early wake up was worth it!"

What Sainsbury's says

Mirror Money contacted Sainsbury's for a comment on the sale and can confirm only selected branches are participating.

"A small number of stores have reduced some Dyson models to clear a very small amount of residual stock," a statement said.

The spokeswoman added that the deal is live on a 'once it's gone, it's gone' basis and that stock is incredibly limited.

The supermarket is yet to release a list of participating stores, so if you’re planning on heading down to grab yourself a bargain, we advise you call your local Sainsbury’s first to avoid disappointment.
description: Sainsbury's has confirmed the deal is legitimate online - however, it has warned that the offer is not nationwide
